MEANHack ’16
30 Teams | 24 hours | 15 mentors | 3 ideas | 1 winner
Learn More
December 16th, 2016
08:00 AM IST
M-Heights, Rushikonda
Bring out the Innovator in you!!
Do you have what it takes to be crowned the Best Digital Innovation Team at Digital Summit 2016? Join us at MEANHack ’16 which will be a unique 24 hour hack-a-thon, where 30 students teams will compete against one another to become the best. The event will focus around Cloud and MEAN Stack technologies, where students will have to learn and create a working prototype of one of the 3 ideas that Miracle gives them. The ideas will be focussed on Mobility, Internet of Things, Cloud Computing and Cognitive.
MEANHack ’16 will be held at Miracle Heights, Rushikonda which is Miracle’s APAC HQ. You can choose your area in the location to work, make sure to choose the best for your team! Your lunch, snacks, dinner and more will all be provided by Miracle and we will try and add some fun and games as well to the work. While your dress code is up to you, please do ensure that you wear something that is comfortable and unobtrusive to others in the area. We would like to provide a harassment free area for all the attendees, any negligence to this code of conduct will be treated with punishment.
The top 3 teams with the best implementation of the ideas will be awarded and recognized, with Miracle sponsoring over 1 Lakh rupees which are to be won in cash prizes.
Selection Process Timeline
Registrations Open
What is MEANHack?
Registrations Close
Final 30 Teams Announced
Training Material Provided
Webinar for Team Questions
Event Rules and Details
  • Each team will consist of a minimum of 3 members and a maximum of 4 members – All students will need to be from B.Tech 3rd year (or) 4th year
  • All team members will need to bring their own laptop – WIFI, Power and seating area will be provided by Miracle
  • Final 30 teams selection is up to Miracle – Not all teams that are registered will be selected to participate
  • Any detection of plagiarism, misconduct, (or) unlawful behavior will result in the disqualification of the team from the event
  • Each team must participate in the full event – leaving in the middle will render the college and the students ineligible for any future Miracle/AP Cloud programs
Select your Track
Enterprise Mobility
Come and build a mobile application that will help Miracle’s Employee interact with facilities teams better through technology. This track will involve technologies such as Ionic, Angular, Sockets, Node JS, Image Encoding, Cloudant and more.
Cognitive Computing
Come and build a chatbot that will change the way that all the Miraclites interact with the Innovation Labs team for tasks. This track will involve technologies such as Watson, Node JS, Sockets, APIs, Cloudant, IBM Bluemix and more.
Connected Solutions
Come and build a solution that will help Miracle’s Bus Schedule optimization with the help of RFID technology and a very cool dashboard. This track will involve technologies such as Angular, Sockets, Node JS, RFID, IBM Bluemix and more.
Scoring and Judging
The scoring process will not only include your final demonstration but also your overall performance and attitude throughout the event. The following elements will be used to judge your performance and points,
  • Code Quality and UI/UX of application
  • Innovation behind the functional idea
  • Percentage of completion towards the problem case
  • Aptness in solving the problem at hand
  • Demo mechanism and presentation speech quality
  • Time/Task/Team Management
  • Overall behavior/attitude of the team
